action.action-desc: Ms. Lummis (for herself and Mr. Barrasso) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, with respect to the requirement to test drivers of commercial motor vehicles for English proficiency, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as Connor’s Law.

section.header: Requiring minimum language skills for commercial motor vehicle operators

subsection.text: Section 31308(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (B), by adding and after the semicolon at the end; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: can read and speak the English language sufficiently—

clause.text: to converse with the general public;
to understand highway traffic signs and signals in the English language;
to respond to official inquiries; and
to make entries on reports and records;

subsection.header: Out-of-Service order for noncompliance with minimum language requirement

paragraph.text: An individual operating a commercial motor vehicle who is determined by an authorized enforcement officer to be noncompliant with section 391.11(b)(2) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations (or a successor regulation), shall be declared out of service.
Nothing in paragraph (1) changes, limits, or otherwise impacts an out-of-service order that—

subparagraph.text: is not covered under that paragraph; and
is carried out pursuant to applicable Federal law (including regulations) or the North American Standard Out-of-Service Criteria.
